optimization.algorithms.evolutionary.geneticÂ¶

Source: src\optimization\algorithms\evolutionary\genetic.py

Module OverviewÂ¶

Genetic Algorithm implementation for control parameter optimization.

Advanced Mathematical TheoryÂ¶

Genetic Algorithm (GA)Â¶

Population evolution:

\[\mathcal{P}^{t+1} = \text{Mutate}(\text{Crossover}(\text{Select}(\mathcal{P}^t)))\]

Selection OperatorsÂ¶

Roulette wheel selection:

\[P(\vec{x}_i \text{ selected}) = \frac{f(\vec{x}_i)}{\sum_j f(\vec{x}_j)}\]

Tournament selection:

\[\vec{x}_{winner} = \arg\max_{\vec{x} \in \text{Tournament}} f(\vec{x})\]

Rank-based selection:

\[P(\vec{x}_i) = \frac{N - \text{rank}(\vec{x}_i) + 1}{\sum_j (N - \text{rank}(\vec{x}_j) + 1)}\]

Crossover OperatorsÂ¶

Single-point crossover:

\[\begin{split}\begin{align} \text{Child}_1[1:k] &= \text{Parent}_1[1:k], \quad \text{Child}_1[k+1:n] = \text{Parent}_2[k+1:n] \\ \text{Child}_2[1:k] &= \text{Parent}_2[1:k], \quad \text{Child}_2[k+1:n] = \text{Parent}_1[k+1:n] \end{align}\end{split}\]

Uniform crossover:

\[\begin{split}\text{Child}_i[j] = \begin{cases} \text{Parent}_1[j], & r_j < 0.5 \\ \text{Parent}_2[j], & r_j \geq 0.5 \end{cases}\end{split}\]

Mutation OperatorsÂ¶

Bit-flip mutation (binary encoding):

\[\begin{split}x_i' = \begin{cases} 1 - x_i, & r < p_m \\ x_i, & r \geq p_m \end{cases}\end{split}\]

Gaussian mutation (real encoding):

\[x_i' = x_i + \mathcal{N}(0, \sigma^2)\]

Schema TheoremÂ¶

Hollandâ€™s Schema Theorem:

\[E[m(H, t+1)] \geq m(H, t) \cdot \frac{f(H)}{\bar{f}} \cdot \left[1 - p_c \delta(H) - o(H)p_m\right]\]

Where:

  • \(m(H, t)\): Number of schema \(H\) instances at generation \(t\)

  • \(f(H)\): Average fitness of schema

  • \(\delta(H)\): Defining length

  • \(o(H)\): Order (number of fixed positions)

Implication: Short, low-order, above-average schemata grow exponentially.

Architecture DiagramÂ¶

graph TD A[Initialize Population] --> B[Evaluate Fitness] B --> C[Selection] C --> D{Selection Type} D -->|Roulette| E[Fitness Proportional] D -->|Tournament| F[Best of K] D -->|Rank| G[Rank-Based] E --> H[Crossover] F --> H G --> H H --> I{Crossover Type} I -->|Single-Point| J[Single Cut] I -->|Two-Point| K[Two Cuts] I -->|Uniform| L[Random Mix] J --> M[Mutation] K --> M L --> M M --> N[New Population] N --> O[Convergence Check] O --> P{Converged?} P -->|No| B P -->|Yes| Q[Return Best] style D fill:#ff9 style I fill:#9cf style Q fill:#9f9

Usage ExamplesÂ¶

Example 1: Basic InitializationÂ¶

from src.optimization.algorithms import *

# Initialize with configuration
config = {'parameter': 'value'}
instance = Component(config)

Example 2: Performance TuningÂ¶

# Adjust parameters for better performance
optimized_params = tune_parameters(instance, target_performance)

Example 3: Integration with OptimizationÂ¶

# Use in complete optimization loop
optimizer = create_optimizer(opt_type, config)
result = optimize(optimizer, problem, max_iter=100)

Example 4: Edge Case HandlingÂ¶

try:
    output = instance.compute(parameters)
except ValueError as e:
    handle_edge_case(e)

Example 5: Performance AnalysisÂ¶

# Analyze metrics
metrics = compute_metrics(result)
print(f"Best fitness: {metrics.best_fitness:.3f}")

Complete Source CodeÂ¶

  1#======================================================================================\\\
  2#================ src/optimization/algorithms/evolutionary/genetic.py =================\\\
  3#======================================================================================\\\
  4
  5"""Genetic Algorithm implementation for control parameter optimization."""
  6
  7from __future__ import annotations
  8
  9from typing import Any, Dict, List, Optional, Tuple
 10import numpy as np
 11import warnings
 12from dataclasses import dataclass
 13from concurrent.futures import ProcessPoolExecutor
 14import multiprocessing as mp
 15
 16from ..base import OptimizationAlgorithm
 17from ...core.interfaces import OptimizationProblem, ParameterSpace, OptimizationResult
 18from ...core.parameters import ContinuousParameterSpace
 19from src.utils.numerical_stability import EPSILON_DIV
 20
 21
 22@dataclass
 23class GeneticAlgorithmConfig:
 24    """Configuration for Genetic Algorithm."""
 25    population_size: int = 50
 26    max_generations: int = 100
 27    elite_ratio: float = 0.1
 28    crossover_probability: float = 0.8
 29    mutation_probability: float = 0.2
 30    mutation_strength: float = 0.1
 31    tournament_size: int = 3
 32    crossover_method: str = 'uniform'
 33    mutation_method: str = 'gaussian'
 34    selection_method: str = 'tournament'
 35    diversity_preservation: bool = True
 36    adaptive_parameters: bool = False
 37    parallel_evaluation: bool = True
 38    random_seed: Optional[int] = None
 39
 40
 41class Individual:
 42    """Individual in the genetic algorithm population."""
 43
 44    def __init__(self, genes: np.ndarray, fitness: Optional[float] = None):
 45        self.genes = genes.copy()
 46        self.fitness = fitness
 47        self.age = 0
 48        self.id = np.random.randint(0, 1000000)
 49
 50    def copy(self) -> 'Individual':
 51        """Create a copy of the individual."""
 52        copy_ind = Individual(self.genes, self.fitness)
 53        copy_ind.age = self.age
 54        copy_ind.id = self.id
 55        return copy_ind
 56
 57    def __str__(self) -> str:
 58        return f"Individual(genes={self.genes[:3]}..., fitness={self.fitness})"
 59
 60
 61class GeneticAlgorithm(OptimizationAlgorithm):
 62    """Genetic Algorithm for parameter optimization.
 63
 64    A population-based evolutionary algorithm that uses selection, crossover,
 65    and mutation operators to evolve a population of candidate solutions.
 66
 67    Features:
 68    - Multiple selection methods (tournament, roulette, rank)
 69    - Various crossover operators (uniform, single-point, arithmetic)
 70    - Adaptive mutation strategies
 71    - Elitist preservation
 72    - Diversity maintenance
 73    - Parallel fitness evaluation
 74    """
 75
 76    def __init__(self, config: Optional[GeneticAlgorithmConfig] = None):
 77        """Initialize Genetic Algorithm.
 78
 79        Parameters
 80        ----------
 81        config : GeneticAlgorithmConfig, optional
 82            Algorithm configuration. If None, uses default values.
 83        """
 84        super().__init__()
 85        self.config = config if config is not None else GeneticAlgorithmConfig()
 86
 87        # Initialize random number generator
 88        if self.config.random_seed is not None:
 89            np.random.seed(self.config.random_seed)
 90
 91        # Algorithm state
 92        self.population: List[Individual] = []
 93        self.generation = 0
 94        self.best_individual: Optional[Individual] = None
 95        self.fitness_history: List[float] = []
 96        self.diversity_history: List[float] = []
 97
 98        # Adaptive parameters
 99        self.current_mutation_strength = self.config.mutation_strength
100        self.current_crossover_prob = self.config.crossover_probability
101        self.stagnation_counter = 0
102
103    def optimize(self,
104                problem: OptimizationProblem,
105                parameter_space: ParameterSpace,
106                **kwargs) -> OptimizationResult:
107        """Run genetic algorithm optimization.
108
109        Parameters
110        ----------
111        problem : OptimizationProblem
112            The optimization problem to solve
113        parameter_space : ParameterSpace
114            Parameter space defining bounds and constraints
115
116        Returns
117        -------
118        OptimizationResult
119            Optimization results including best parameters and convergence history
120        """
121        if not isinstance(parameter_space, ContinuousParameterSpace):
122            raise ValueError("GeneticAlgorithm currently only supports ContinuousParameterSpace")
123
124        self.problem = problem
125        self.parameter_space = parameter_space
126        self.dimension = len(parameter_space.lower_bounds)
127
128        # Initialize algorithm
129        self._initialize_population()
130        self._evaluate_population()
131
132        # Evolution loop
133        for generation in range(self.config.max_generations):
134            self.generation = generation
135
136            # Create new generation
137            new_population = self._create_new_generation()
138
139            # Evaluate new population
140            self.population = new_population
141            self._evaluate_population()
142
143            # Update algorithm state
144            self._update_algorithm_state()
145
146            # Check convergence
147            if self._check_convergence():
148                break
149
150        # Create result
151        result = self._create_result()
152        return result
153
154    def _initialize_population(self) -> None:
155        """Initialize the population randomly."""
156        self.population = []
157
158        for _ in range(self.config.population_size):
159            # Generate random genes within bounds
160            genes = np.random.uniform(
161                self.parameter_space.lower_bounds,
162                self.parameter_space.upper_bounds
163            )
164
165            individual = Individual(genes)
166            self.population.append(individual)
167
168    def _evaluate_population(self) -> None:
169        """Evaluate fitness for all individuals in population."""
170        if self.config.parallel_evaluation and len(self.population) > 4:
171            self._evaluate_population_parallel()
172        else:
173            self._evaluate_population_serial()
174
175        # Update best individual
176        self._update_best_individual()
177
178    def _evaluate_population_serial(self) -> None:
179        """Evaluate population serially."""
180        for individual in self.population:
181            if individual.fitness is None:
182                try:
183                    individual.fitness = self.problem.evaluate(individual.genes)
184                except Exception as e:
185                    warnings.warn(f"Evaluation failed for individual: {e}")
186                    individual.fitness = float('inf')
187
188    def _evaluate_population_parallel(self) -> None:
189        """Evaluate population in parallel."""
190        try:
191            with ProcessPoolExecutor(max_workers=mp.cpu_count()) as executor:
192                # Submit evaluation jobs
193                futures = []
194                for individual in self.population:
195                    if individual.fitness is None:
196                        future = executor.submit(self._safe_evaluate, individual.genes)
197                        futures.append((individual, future))
198
199                # Collect results
200                for individual, future in futures:
201                    try:
202                        individual.fitness = future.result(timeout=30)
203                    except Exception as e:
204                        warnings.warn(f"Parallel evaluation failed: {e}")
205                        individual.fitness = float('inf')
206
207        except Exception as e:
208            # Fall back to serial evaluation
209            warnings.warn(f"Parallel evaluation setup failed, using serial: {e}")
210            self._evaluate_population_serial()
211
212    def _safe_evaluate(self, genes: np.ndarray) -> float:
213        """Safe evaluation wrapper for parallel processing."""
214        try:
215            return self.problem.evaluate(genes)
216        except Exception:
217            return float('inf')
218
219    def _create_new_generation(self) -> List[Individual]:
220        """Create new generation using selection, crossover, and mutation."""
221        new_population = []
222
223        # Elitism - preserve best individuals
224        elite_count = max(1, int(self.config.elite_ratio * self.config.population_size))
225        elite_individuals = self._select_elite(elite_count)
226        new_population.extend([ind.copy() for ind in elite_individuals])
227
228        # Generate offspring to fill remaining population
229        while len(new_population) < self.config.population_size:
230            # Selection
231            parent1 = self._select_individual()
232            parent2 = self._select_individual()
233
234            # Crossover
235            if np.random.random() < self.current_crossover_prob:
236                child1, child2 = self._crossover(parent1, parent2)
237            else:
238                child1, child2 = parent1.copy(), parent2.copy()
239
240            # Mutation
241            if np.random.random() < self.config.mutation_probability:
242                child1 = self._mutate(child1)
243            if np.random.random() < self.config.mutation_probability:
244                child2 = self._mutate(child2)
245
246            # Add children to new population
247            new_population.extend([child1, child2])
248
249        # Trim population to exact size
250        new_population = new_population[:self.config.population_size]
251
252        # Age individuals
253        for individual in new_population:
254            individual.age += 1
255
256        return new_population
257
258    def _select_elite(self, count: int) -> List[Individual]:
259        """Select elite individuals (best fitness)."""
260        sorted_population = sorted(self.population, key=lambda x: x.fitness or float('inf'))
261        return sorted_population[:count]
262
263    def _select_individual(self) -> Individual:
264        """Select individual based on selection method."""
265        if self.config.selection_method == 'tournament':
266            return self._tournament_selection()
267        elif self.config.selection_method == 'roulette':
268            return self._roulette_selection()
269        elif self.config.selection_method == 'rank':
270            return self._rank_selection()
271        else:
272            # Default to tournament
273            return self._tournament_selection()
274
275    def _tournament_selection(self) -> Individual:
276        """Tournament selection."""
277        tournament_size = min(self.config.tournament_size, len(self.population))
278        tournament = np.random.choice(self.population, tournament_size, replace=False)
279        winner = min(tournament, key=lambda x: x.fitness or float('inf'))
280        return winner.copy()
281
282    def _roulette_selection(self) -> Individual:
283        """Roulette wheel selection."""
284        # Convert fitness to selection probabilities (lower is better)
285        fitnesses = np.array([ind.fitness or float('inf') for ind in self.population])
286
287        # Handle infinite fitness
288        if np.any(np.isinf(fitnesses)):
289            finite_mask = np.isfinite(fitnesses)
290            if not np.any(finite_mask):
291                # All infinite - random selection
292                return np.random.choice(self.population).copy()
293            fitnesses[~finite_mask] = np.max(fitnesses[finite_mask]) * 10
294
295        # Convert to probabilities (invert for minimization)
296        max_fitness = np.max(fitnesses)
297        if max_fitness > 0:
298            # Issue #13: Standardized division protection
299            weights = (max_fitness - fitnesses) + EPSILON_DIV
300        else:
301            weights = np.ones_like(fitnesses)
302
303        probabilities = weights / np.sum(weights)
304        selected_idx = np.random.choice(len(self.population), p=probabilities)
305        return self.population[selected_idx].copy()
306
307    def _rank_selection(self) -> Individual:
308        """Rank-based selection."""
309        # Sort by fitness (best first)
310        sorted_indices = np.argsort([ind.fitness or float('inf') for ind in self.population])
311
312        # Assign ranks (higher rank = better fitness)
313        ranks = np.zeros(len(self.population))
314        for i, idx in enumerate(sorted_indices):
315            ranks[idx] = len(self.population) - i
316
317        # Selection probabilities based on ranks
318        probabilities = ranks / np.sum(ranks)
319        selected_idx = np.random.choice(len(self.population), p=probabilities)
320        return self.population[selected_idx].copy()
321
322    def _crossover(self, parent1: Individual, parent2: Individual) -> Tuple[Individual, Individual]:
323        """Perform crossover between two parents."""
324        if self.config.crossover_method == 'uniform':
325            return self._uniform_crossover(parent1, parent2)
326        elif self.config.crossover_method == 'single_point':
327            return self._single_point_crossover(parent1, parent2)
328        elif self.config.crossover_method == 'arithmetic':
329            return self._arithmetic_crossover(parent1, parent2)
330        else:
331            return self._uniform_crossover(parent1, parent2)
332
333    def _uniform_crossover(self, parent1: Individual, parent2: Individual) -> Tuple[Individual, Individual]:
334        """Uniform crossover - each gene has 50% chance of coming from either parent."""
335        mask = np.random.random(self.dimension) < 0.5
336
337        child1_genes = np.where(mask, parent1.genes, parent2.genes)
338        child2_genes = np.where(mask, parent2.genes, parent1.genes)
339
340        child1 = Individual(child1_genes)
341        child2 = Individual(child2_genes)
342
343        return child1, child2
344
345    def _single_point_crossover(self, parent1: Individual, parent2: Individual) -> Tuple[Individual, Individual]:
346        """Single-point crossover."""
347        if self.dimension <= 1:
348            return parent1.copy(), parent2.copy()
349
350        crossover_point = np.random.randint(1, self.dimension)
351
352        child1_genes = np.concatenate([parent1.genes[:crossover_point], parent2.genes[crossover_point:]])
353        child2_genes = np.concatenate([parent2.genes[:crossover_point], parent1.genes[crossover_point:]])
354
355        child1 = Individual(child1_genes)
356        child2 = Individual(child2_genes)
357
358        return child1, child2
359
360    def _arithmetic_crossover(self, parent1: Individual, parent2: Individual) -> Tuple[Individual, Individual]:
361        """Arithmetic crossover - weighted average of parents."""
362        alpha = np.random.random()
363
364        child1_genes = alpha * parent1.genes + (1 - alpha) * parent2.genes
365        child2_genes = (1 - alpha) * parent1.genes + alpha * parent2.genes
366
367        child1 = Individual(child1_genes)
368        child2 = Individual(child2_genes)
369
370        return child1, child2
371
372    def _mutate(self, individual: Individual) -> Individual:
373        """Mutate an individual."""
374        if self.config.mutation_method == 'gaussian':
375            return self._gaussian_mutation(individual)
376        elif self.config.mutation_method == 'uniform':
377            return self._uniform_mutation(individual)
378        elif self.config.mutation_method == 'polynomial':
379            return self._polynomial_mutation(individual)
380        else:
381            return self._gaussian_mutation(individual)
382
383    def _gaussian_mutation(self, individual: Individual) -> Individual:
384        """Gaussian mutation - add normally distributed noise."""
385        mutated_genes = individual.genes.copy()
386
387        # Add Gaussian noise
388        noise = np.random.normal(0, self.current_mutation_strength, self.dimension)
389        mutated_genes += noise * (self.parameter_space.upper_bounds - self.parameter_space.lower_bounds)
390
391        # Clip to bounds
392        mutated_genes = np.clip(mutated_genes,
393                               self.parameter_space.lower_bounds,
394                               self.parameter_space.upper_bounds)
395
396        return Individual(mutated_genes)
397
398    def _uniform_mutation(self, individual: Individual) -> Individual:
399        """Uniform mutation - replace with random value in range."""
400        mutated_genes = individual.genes.copy()
401
402        # Randomly select genes to mutate
403        mutation_mask = np.random.random(self.dimension) < 0.1  # 10% of genes
404
405        # Replace selected genes with random values
406        random_values = np.random.uniform(self.parameter_space.lower_bounds,
407                                        self.parameter_space.upper_bounds)
408        mutated_genes[mutation_mask] = random_values[mutation_mask]
409
410        return Individual(mutated_genes)
411
412    def _polynomial_mutation(self, individual: Individual) -> Individual:
413        """Polynomial mutation."""
414        eta = 20.0  # Distribution index
415        mutated_genes = individual.genes.copy()
416
417        for i in range(self.dimension):
418            if np.random.random() < (1.0 / self.dimension):
419                y = mutated_genes[i]
420                yl = self.parameter_space.lower_bounds[i]
421                yu = self.parameter_space.upper_bounds[i]
422
423                delta1 = (y - yl) / (yu - yl)
424                delta2 = (yu - y) / (yu - yl)
425
426                rand = np.random.random()
427                mut_pow = 1.0 / (eta + 1.0)
428
429                if rand <= 0.5:
430                    xy = 1.0 - delta1
431                    val = 2.0 * rand + (1.0 - 2.0 * rand) * (xy ** (eta + 1.0))
432                    deltaq = val ** mut_pow - 1.0
433                else:
434                    xy = 1.0 - delta2
435                    val = 2.0 * (1.0 - rand) + 2.0 * (rand - 0.5) * (xy ** (eta + 1.0))
436                    deltaq = 1.0 - (val ** mut_pow)
437
438                y = y + deltaq * (yu - yl)
439                y = max(yl, min(y, yu))
440                mutated_genes[i] = y
441
442        return Individual(mutated_genes)
443
444    def _update_algorithm_state(self) -> None:
445        """Update algorithm state after each generation."""
446        # Update fitness history
447        best_fitness = min(ind.fitness or float('inf') for ind in self.population)
448        self.fitness_history.append(best_fitness)
449
450        # Update diversity history
451        diversity = self._calculate_diversity()
452        self.diversity_history.append(diversity)
453
454        # Adaptive parameters
455        if self.config.adaptive_parameters:
456            self._update_adaptive_parameters()
457
458    def _update_best_individual(self) -> None:
459        """Update the best individual found so far."""
460        current_best = min(self.population, key=lambda x: x.fitness or float('inf'))
461
462        if (self.best_individual is None or
463            (current_best.fitness or float('inf')) < (self.best_individual.fitness or float('inf'))):
464            self.best_individual = current_best.copy()
465            self.stagnation_counter = 0
466        else:
467            self.stagnation_counter += 1
468
469    def _calculate_diversity(self) -> float:
470        """Calculate population diversity."""
471        if len(self.population) < 2:
472            return 0.0
473
474        # Calculate average pairwise distance
475        distances = []
476        for i in range(len(self.population)):
477            for j in range(i + 1, len(self.population)):
478                distance = np.linalg.norm(self.population[i].genes - self.population[j].genes)
479                distances.append(distance)
480
481        return np.mean(distances) if distances else 0.0
482
483    def _update_adaptive_parameters(self) -> None:
484        """Update adaptive algorithm parameters."""
485        # Increase mutation if stagnating
486        if self.stagnation_counter > 10:
487            self.current_mutation_strength = min(self.current_mutation_strength * 1.1, 0.5)
488        else:
489            self.current_mutation_strength = max(self.current_mutation_strength * 0.99,
490                                               self.config.mutation_strength)
491
492        # Adjust crossover probability based on diversity
493        if len(self.diversity_history) > 5:
494            recent_diversity = np.mean(self.diversity_history[-5:])
495            if recent_diversity < 0.01:  # Low diversity
496                self.current_crossover_prob = min(self.current_crossover_prob * 1.05, 0.95)
497            else:
498                self.current_crossover_prob = max(self.current_crossover_prob * 0.99,
499                                                self.config.crossover_probability)
500
501    def _check_convergence(self) -> bool:
502        """Check if algorithm has converged."""
503        # Check if fitness improvement has stagnated
504        if len(self.fitness_history) > 20:
505            recent_improvement = abs(self.fitness_history[-1] - self.fitness_history[-20])
506            # Issue #13: Standardized epsilon for convergence check
507            if recent_improvement < EPSILON_DIV:
508                return True
509
510        # Check if diversity is too low
511        if self.config.diversity_preservation and len(self.diversity_history) > 10:
512            recent_diversity = np.mean(self.diversity_history[-10:])
513            if recent_diversity < 1e-8:
514                return True
515
516        return False
517
518    def _create_result(self) -> OptimizationResult:
519        """Create optimization result."""
520        return OptimizationResult(
521            best_parameters=self.best_individual.genes.copy() if self.best_individual else np.array([]),
522            best_value=self.best_individual.fitness if self.best_individual else float('inf'),
523            n_evaluations=len(self.fitness_history) * self.config.population_size,
524            convergence_history=self.fitness_history.copy(),
525            success=self.best_individual is not None and np.isfinite(self.best_individual.fitness),
526            algorithm_info={
527                'algorithm': 'GeneticAlgorithm',
528                'generations': self.generation + 1,
529                'population_size': self.config.population_size,
530                'final_diversity': self.diversity_history[-1] if self.diversity_history else 0.0,
531                'stagnation_counter': self.stagnation_counter,
532                'adaptive_mutation_strength': self.current_mutation_strength,
533                'adaptive_crossover_prob': self.current_crossover_prob
534            }
535        )
536
537    def get_population_statistics(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
538        """Get statistics about current population."""
539        if not self.population:
540            return {}
541
542        fitnesses = [ind.fitness for ind in self.population if ind.fitness is not None]
543        if not fitnesses:
544            return {}
545
546        stats = {
547            'generation': self.generation,
548            'population_size': len(self.population),
549            'best_fitness': min(fitnesses),
550            'worst_fitness': max(fitnesses),
551            'mean_fitness': np.mean(fitnesses),
552            'std_fitness': np.std(fitnesses),
553            'diversity': self._calculate_diversity(),
554            'convergence_rate': self._estimate_convergence_rate(),
555            'selection_pressure': self._calculate_selection_pressure()
556        }
557
558        return stats
559
560    def _estimate_convergence_rate(self) -> float:
561        """Estimate convergence rate from fitness history."""
562        if len(self.fitness_history) < 10:
563            return 0.0
564
565        # Linear regression on log fitness improvement
566        recent_history = self.fitness_history[-10:]
567        x = np.arange(len(recent_history))
568        # Issue #13: Standardized division protection for log domain
569        y = np.log(np.maximum(recent_history, EPSILON_DIV))
570
571        try:
572            slope, _ = np.polyfit(x, y, 1)
573            return abs(slope)
574        except Exception:
575            return 0.0
576
577    def _calculate_selection_pressure(self) -> float:
578        """Calculate selection pressure in population."""
579        fitnesses = [ind.fitness for ind in self.population if ind.fitness is not None]
580        if len(fitnesses) < 2:
581            return 0.0
582
583        best_fitness = min(fitnesses)
584        mean_fitness = np.mean(fitnesses)
585
586        if mean_fitness > 0:
587            return (mean_fitness - best_fitness) / mean_fitness
588        else:
589            return 0.0

 4    population_size: int = 50
 5    max_generations: int = 100
 6    elite_ratio: float = 0.1
 7    crossover_probability: float = 0.8
 8    mutation_probability: float = 0.2
 9    mutation_strength: float = 0.1

12    mutation_method: str = 'gaussian'

IndividualÂ¶

Individual in the genetic algorithm population.

Source CodeÂ¶

 1class Individual:
 2    """Individual in the genetic algorithm population."""
 3
 4    def __init__(self, genes: np.ndarray, fitness: Optional[float] = None):
 5        self.genes = genes.copy()
 6        self.fitness = fitness
 7        self.age = 0
 8        self.id = np.random.randint(0, 1000000)
 9
10    def copy(self) -> 'Individual':
11        """Create a copy of the individual."""
12        copy_ind = Individual(self.genes, self.fitness)
13        copy_ind.age = self.age
14        copy_ind.id = self.id
15        return copy_ind
16
17    def __str__(self) -> str:
18        return f"Individual(genes={self.genes[:3]}..., fitness={self.fitness})"

GeneticAlgorithmÂ¶

Inherits from: OptimizationAlgorithm

Genetic Algorithm for parameter optimization.

A population-based evolutionary algorithm that uses selection, crossover, and mutation operators to evolve a population of candidate solutions.

Features:

  • Multiple selection methods (tournament, roulette, rank)

  • Various crossover operators (uniform, single-point, arithmetic)

  • Adaptive mutation strategies

  • Elitist preservation

  • Diversity maintenance

  • Parallel fitness evaluation

Source CodeÂ¶

  1class GeneticAlgorithm(OptimizationAlgorithm):
  2    """Genetic Algorithm for parameter optimization.
  3
  4    A population-based evolutionary algorithm that uses selection, crossover,
  5    and mutation operators to evolve a population of candidate solutions.
  6
  7    Features:
  8    - Multiple selection methods (tournament, roulette, rank)
  9    - Various crossover operators (uniform, single-point, arithmetic)
 10    - Adaptive mutation strategies
 11    - Elitist preservation
 12    - Diversity maintenance
 13    - Parallel fitness evaluation
 14    """
 15
 16    def __init__(self, config: Optional[GeneticAlgorithmConfig] = None):
 17        """Initialize Genetic Algorithm.
 18
 19        Parameters
 20        ----------
 21        config : GeneticAlgorithmConfig, optional
 22            Algorithm configuration. If None, uses default values.
 23        """
 24        super().__init__()
 25        self.config = config if config is not None else GeneticAlgorithmConfig()
 26
 27        # Initialize random number generator
 28        if self.config.random_seed is not None:
 29            np.random.seed(self.config.random_seed)
 30
 31        # Algorithm state
 32        self.population: List[Individual] = []
 33        self.generation = 0
 34        self.best_individual: Optional[Individual] = None
 35        self.fitness_history: List[float] = []
 36        self.diversity_history: List[float] = []
 37
 38        # Adaptive parameters
 39        self.current_mutation_strength = self.config.mutation_strength
 40        self.current_crossover_prob = self.config.crossover_probability
 41        self.stagnation_counter = 0
 42
 43    def optimize(self,
 44                problem: OptimizationProblem,
 45                parameter_space: ParameterSpace,
 46                **kwargs) -> OptimizationResult:
 47        """Run genetic algorithm optimization.
 48
 49        Parameters
 50        ----------
 51        problem : OptimizationProblem
 52            The optimization problem to solve
 53        parameter_space : ParameterSpace
 54            Parameter space defining bounds and constraints
 55
 56        Returns
 57        -------
 58        OptimizationResult
 59            Optimization results including best parameters and convergence history
 60        """
 61        if not isinstance(parameter_space, ContinuousParameterSpace):
 62            raise ValueError("GeneticAlgorithm currently only supports ContinuousParameterSpace")
 63
 64        self.problem = problem
 65        self.parameter_space = parameter_space
 66        self.dimension = len(parameter_space.lower_bounds)
 67
 68        # Initialize algorithm
 69        self._initialize_population()
 70        self._evaluate_population()
 71
 72        # Evolution loop
 73        for generation in range(self.config.max_generations):
 74            self.generation = generation
 75
 76            # Create new generation
 77            new_population = self._create_new_generation()
 78
 79            # Evaluate new population
 80            self.population = new_population
 81            self._evaluate_population()
 82
 83            # Update algorithm state
 84            self._update_algorithm_state()
 85
 86            # Check convergence
 87            if self._check_convergence():
 88                break
 89
 90        # Create result
 91        result = self._create_result()
 92        return result
 93
 94    def _initialize_population(self) -> None:
 95        """Initialize the population randomly."""
 96        self.population = []
 97
 98        for _ in range(self.config.population_size):
 99            # Generate random genes within bounds
100            genes = np.random.uniform(
101                self.parameter_space.lower_bounds,
102                self.parameter_space.upper_bounds
103            )
104
105            individual = Individual(genes)
106            self.population.append(individual)
107
108    def _evaluate_population(self) -> None:
109        """Evaluate fitness for all individuals in population."""
110        if self.config.parallel_evaluation and len(self.population) > 4:
111            self._evaluate_population_parallel()
112        else:
113            self._evaluate_population_serial()
114
115        # Update best individual
116        self._update_best_individual()
117
118    def _evaluate_population_serial(self) -> None:
119        """Evaluate population serially."""
120        for individual in self.population:
121            if individual.fitness is None:
122                try:
123                    individual.fitness = self.problem.evaluate(individual.genes)
124                except Exception as e:
125                    warnings.warn(f"Evaluation failed for individual: {e}")
126                    individual.fitness = float('inf')
127
128    def _evaluate_population_parallel(self) -> None:
129        """Evaluate population in parallel."""
130        try:
131            with ProcessPoolExecutor(max_workers=mp.cpu_count()) as executor:
132                # Submit evaluation jobs
133                futures = []
134                for individual in self.population:
135                    if individual.fitness is None:
136                        future = executor.submit(self._safe_evaluate, individual.genes)
137                        futures.append((individual, future))
138
139                # Collect results
140                for individual, future in futures:
141                    try:
142                        individual.fitness = future.result(timeout=30)
143                    except Exception as e:
144                        warnings.warn(f"Parallel evaluation failed: {e}")
145                        individual.fitness = float('inf')
146
147        except Exception as e:
148            # Fall back to serial evaluation
149            warnings.warn(f"Parallel evaluation setup failed, using serial: {e}")
150            self._evaluate_population_serial()
151
152    def _safe_evaluate(self, genes: np.ndarray) -> float:
153        """Safe evaluation wrapper for parallel processing."""
154        try:
155            return self.problem.evaluate(genes)
156        except Exception:
157            return float('inf')
158
159    def _create_new_generation(self) -> List[Individual]:
160        """Create new generation using selection, crossover, and mutation."""
161        new_population = []
162
163        # Elitism - preserve best individuals
164        elite_count = max(1, int(self.config.elite_ratio * self.config.population_size))
165        elite_individuals = self._select_elite(elite_count)
166        new_population.extend([ind.copy() for ind in elite_individuals])
167
168        # Generate offspring to fill remaining population
169        while len(new_population) < self.config.population_size:
170            # Selection
171            parent1 = self._select_individual()
172            parent2 = self._select_individual()
173
174            # Crossover
175            if np.random.random() < self.current_crossover_prob:
176                child1, child2 = self._crossover(parent1, parent2)
177            else:
178                child1, child2 = parent1.copy(), parent2.copy()
179
180            # Mutation
181            if np.random.random() < self.config.mutation_probability:
182                child1 = self._mutate(child1)
183            if np.random.random() < self.config.mutation_probability:
184                child2 = self._mutate(child2)
185
186            # Add children to new population
187            new_population.extend([child1, child2])
188
189        # Trim population to exact size
190        new_population = new_population[:self.config.population_size]
191
192        # Age individuals
193        for individual in new_population:
194            individual.age += 1
195
196        return new_population
197
198    def _select_elite(self, count: int) -> List[Individual]:
199        """Select elite individuals (best fitness)."""
200        sorted_population = sorted(self.population, key=lambda x: x.fitness or float('inf'))
201        return sorted_population[:count]
202
203    def _select_individual(self) -> Individual:
204        """Select individual based on selection method."""
205        if self.config.selection_method == 'tournament':
206            return self._tournament_selection()
207        elif self.config.selection_method == 'roulette':
208            return self._roulette_selection()
209        elif self.config.selection_method == 'rank':
210            return self._rank_selection()
211        else:
212            # Default to tournament
213            return self._tournament_selection()
214
215    def _tournament_selection(self) -> Individual:
216        """Tournament selection."""
217        tournament_size = min(self.config.tournament_size, len(self.population))
218        tournament = np.random.choice(self.population, tournament_size, replace=False)
219        winner = min(tournament, key=lambda x: x.fitness or float('inf'))
220        return winner.copy()
221
222    def _roulette_selection(self) -> Individual:
223        """Roulette wheel selection."""
224        # Convert fitness to selection probabilities (lower is better)
225        fitnesses = np.array([ind.fitness or float('inf') for ind in self.population])
226
227        # Handle infinite fitness
228        if np.any(np.isinf(fitnesses)):
229            finite_mask = np.isfinite(fitnesses)
230            if not np.any(finite_mask):
231                # All infinite - random selection
232                return np.random.choice(self.population).copy()
233            fitnesses[~finite_mask] = np.max(fitnesses[finite_mask]) * 10
234
235        # Convert to probabilities (invert for minimization)
236        max_fitness = np.max(fitnesses)
237        if max_fitness > 0:
238            # Issue #13: Standardized division protection
239            weights = (max_fitness - fitnesses) + EPSILON_DIV
240        else:
241            weights = np.ones_like(fitnesses)
242
243        probabilities = weights / np.sum(weights)
244        selected_idx = np.random.choice(len(self.population), p=probabilities)
245        return self.population[selected_idx].copy()
246
247    def _rank_selection(self) -> Individual:
248        """Rank-based selection."""
249        # Sort by fitness (best first)
250        sorted_indices = np.argsort([ind.fitness or float('inf') for ind in self.population])
251
252        # Assign ranks (higher rank = better fitness)
253        ranks = np.zeros(len(self.population))
254        for i, idx in enumerate(sorted_indices):
255            ranks[idx] = len(self.population) - i
256
257        # Selection probabilities based on ranks
258        probabilities = ranks / np.sum(ranks)
259        selected_idx = np.random.choice(len(self.population), p=probabilities)
260        return self.population[selected_idx].copy()
261
262    def _crossover(self, parent1: Individual, parent2: Individual) -> Tuple[Individual, Individual]:
263        """Perform crossover between two parents."""
264        if self.config.crossover_method == 'uniform':
265            return self._uniform_crossover(parent1, parent2)
266        elif self.config.crossover_method == 'single_point':
267            return self._single_point_crossover(parent1, parent2)
268        elif self.config.crossover_method == 'arithmetic':
269            return self._arithmetic_crossover(parent1, parent2)
270        else:
271            return self._uniform_crossover(parent1, parent2)
272
273    def _uniform_crossover(self, parent1: Individual, parent2: Individual) -> Tuple[Individual, Individual]:
274        """Uniform crossover - each gene has 50% chance of coming from either parent."""
275        mask = np.random.random(self.dimension) < 0.5
276
277        child1_genes = np.where(mask, parent1.genes, parent2.genes)
278        child2_genes = np.where(mask, parent2.genes, parent1.genes)
279
280        child1 = Individual(child1_genes)
281        child2 = Individual(child2_genes)
282
283        return child1, child2
284
285    def _single_point_crossover(self, parent1: Individual, parent2: Individual) -> Tuple[Individual, Individual]:
286        """Single-point crossover."""
287        if self.dimension <= 1:
288            return parent1.copy(), parent2.copy()
289
290        crossover_point = np.random.randint(1, self.dimension)
291
292        child1_genes = np.concatenate([parent1.genes[:crossover_point], parent2.genes[crossover_point:]])
293        child2_genes = np.concatenate([parent2.genes[:crossover_point], parent1.genes[crossover_point:]])
294
295        child1 = Individual(child1_genes)
296        child2 = Individual(child2_genes)
297
298        return child1, child2
299
300    def _arithmetic_crossover(self, parent1: Individual, parent2: Individual) -> Tuple[Individual, Individual]:
301        """Arithmetic crossover - weighted average of parents."""
302        alpha = np.random.random()
303
304        child1_genes = alpha * parent1.genes + (1 - alpha) * parent2.genes
305        child2_genes = (1 - alpha) * parent1.genes + alpha * parent2.genes
306
307        child1 = Individual(child1_genes)
308        child2 = Individual(child2_genes)
309
310        return child1, child2
311
312    def _mutate(self, individual: Individual) -> Individual:
313        """Mutate an individual."""
314        if self.config.mutation_method == 'gaussian':
315            return self._gaussian_mutation(individual)
316        elif self.config.mutation_method == 'uniform':
317            return self._uniform_mutation(individual)
318        elif self.config.mutation_method == 'polynomial':
319            return self._polynomial_mutation(individual)
320        else:
321            return self._gaussian_mutation(individual)
322
323    def _gaussian_mutation(self, individual: Individual) -> Individual:
324        """Gaussian mutation - add normally distributed noise."""
325        mutated_genes = individual.genes.copy()
326
327        # Add Gaussian noise
328        noise = np.random.normal(0, self.current_mutation_strength, self.dimension)
329        mutated_genes += noise * (self.parameter_space.upper_bounds - self.parameter_space.lower_bounds)
330
331        # Clip to bounds
332        mutated_genes = np.clip(mutated_genes,
333                               self.parameter_space.lower_bounds,
334                               self.parameter_space.upper_bounds)
335
336        return Individual(mutated_genes)
337
338    def _uniform_mutation(self, individual: Individual) -> Individual:
339        """Uniform mutation - replace with random value in range."""
340        mutated_genes = individual.genes.copy()
341
342        # Randomly select genes to mutate
343        mutation_mask = np.random.random(self.dimension) < 0.1  # 10% of genes
344
345        # Replace selected genes with random values
346        random_values = np.random.uniform(self.parameter_space.lower_bounds,
347                                        self.parameter_space.upper_bounds)
348        mutated_genes[mutation_mask] = random_values[mutation_mask]
349
350        return Individual(mutated_genes)
351
352    def _polynomial_mutation(self, individual: Individual) -> Individual:
353        """Polynomial mutation."""
354        eta = 20.0  # Distribution index
355        mutated_genes = individual.genes.copy()
356
357        for i in range(self.dimension):
358            if np.random.random() < (1.0 / self.dimension):
359                y = mutated_genes[i]
360                yl = self.parameter_space.lower_bounds[i]
361                yu = self.parameter_space.upper_bounds[i]
362
363                delta1 = (y - yl) / (yu - yl)
364                delta2 = (yu - y) / (yu - yl)
365
366                rand = np.random.random()
367                mut_pow = 1.0 / (eta + 1.0)
368
369                if rand <= 0.5:
370                    xy = 1.0 - delta1
371                    val = 2.0 * rand + (1.0 - 2.0 * rand) * (xy ** (eta + 1.0))
372                    deltaq = val ** mut_pow - 1.0
373                else:
374                    xy = 1.0 - delta2
375                    val = 2.0 * (1.0 - rand) + 2.0 * (rand - 0.5) * (xy ** (eta + 1.0))
376                    deltaq = 1.0 - (val ** mut_pow)
377
378                y = y + deltaq * (yu - yl)
379                y = max(yl, min(y, yu))
380                mutated_genes[i] = y
381
382        return Individual(mutated_genes)
383
384    def _update_algorithm_state(self) -> None:
385        """Update algorithm state after each generation."""
386        # Update fitness history
387        best_fitness = min(ind.fitness or float('inf') for ind in self.population)
388        self.fitness_history.append(best_fitness)
389
390        # Update diversity history
391        diversity = self._calculate_diversity()
392        self.diversity_history.append(diversity)
393
394        # Adaptive parameters
395        if self.config.adaptive_parameters:
396            self._update_adaptive_parameters()
397
398    def _update_best_individual(self) -> None:
399        """Update the best individual found so far."""
400        current_best = min(self.population, key=lambda x: x.fitness or float('inf'))
401
402        if (self.best_individual is None or
403            (current_best.fitness or float('inf')) < (self.best_individual.fitness or float('inf'))):
404            self.best_individual = current_best.copy()
405            self.stagnation_counter = 0
406        else:
407            self.stagnation_counter += 1
408
409    def _calculate_diversity(self) -> float:
410        """Calculate population diversity."""
411        if len(self.population) < 2:
412            return 0.0
413
414        # Calculate average pairwise distance
415        distances = []
416        for i in range(len(self.population)):
417            for j in range(i + 1, len(self.population)):
418                distance = np.linalg.norm(self.population[i].genes - self.population[j].genes)
419                distances.append(distance)
420
421        return np.mean(distances) if distances else 0.0
422
423    def _update_adaptive_parameters(self) -> None:
424        """Update adaptive algorithm parameters."""
425        # Increase mutation if stagnating
426        if self.stagnation_counter > 10:
427            self.current_mutation_strength = min(self.current_mutation_strength * 1.1, 0.5)
428        else:
429            self.current_mutation_strength = max(self.current_mutation_strength * 0.99,
430                                               self.config.mutation_strength)
431
432        # Adjust crossover probability based on diversity
433        if len(self.diversity_history) > 5:
434            recent_diversity = np.mean(self.diversity_history[-5:])
435            if recent_diversity < 0.01:  # Low diversity
436                self.current_crossover_prob = min(self.current_crossover_prob * 1.05, 0.95)
437            else:
438                self.current_crossover_prob = max(self.current_crossover_prob * 0.99,
439                                                self.config.crossover_probability)
440
441    def _check_convergence(self) -> bool:
442        """Check if algorithm has converged."""
443        # Check if fitness improvement has stagnated
444        if len(self.fitness_history) > 20:
445            recent_improvement = abs(self.fitness_history[-1] - self.fitness_history[-20])
446            # Issue #13: Standardized epsilon for convergence check
447            if recent_improvement < EPSILON_DIV:
448                return True
449
450        # Check if diversity is too low
451        if self.config.diversity_preservation and len(self.diversity_history) > 10:
452            recent_diversity = np.mean(self.diversity_history[-10:])
453            if recent_diversity < 1e-8:
454                return True
455
456        return False
457
458    def _create_result(self) -> OptimizationResult:
459        """Create optimization result."""
460        return OptimizationResult(
461            best_parameters=self.best_individual.genes.copy() if self.best_individual else np.array([]),
462            best_value=self.best_individual.fitness if self.best_individual else float('inf'),
463            n_evaluations=len(self.fitness_history) * self.config.population_size,
464            convergence_history=self.fitness_history.copy(),
465            success=self.best_individual is not None and np.isfinite(self.best_individual.fitness),
466            algorithm_info={
467                'algorithm': 'GeneticAlgorithm',
468                'generations': self.generation + 1,
469                'population_size': self.config.population_size,
470                'final_diversity': self.diversity_history[-1] if self.diversity_history else 0.0,
471                'stagnation_counter': self.stagnation_counter,
472                'adaptive_mutation_strength': self.current_mutation_strength,
473                'adaptive_crossover_prob': self.current_crossover_prob
474            }
475        )
476
477    def get_population_statistics(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
478        """Get statistics about current population."""
479        if not self.population:
480            return {}
481
482        fitnesses = [ind.fitness for ind in self.population if ind.fitness is not None]
483        if not fitnesses:
484            return {}
485
486        stats = {
487            'generation': self.generation,
488            'population_size': len(self.population),
489            'best_fitness': min(fitnesses),
490            'worst_fitness': max(fitnesses),
491            'mean_fitness': np.mean(fitnesses),
492            'std_fitness': np.std(fitnesses),
493            'diversity': self._calculate_diversity(),
494            'convergence_rate': self._estimate_convergence_rate(),
495            'selection_pressure': self._calculate_selection_pressure()
496        }
497
498        return stats
499
500    def _estimate_convergence_rate(self) -> float:
501        """Estimate convergence rate from fitness history."""
502        if len(self.fitness_history) < 10:
503            return 0.0
504
505        # Linear regression on log fitness improvement
506        recent_history = self.fitness_history[-10:]
507        x = np.arange(len(recent_history))
508        # Issue #13: Standardized division protection for log domain
509        y = np.log(np.maximum(recent_history, EPSILON_DIV))
510
511        try:
512            slope, _ = np.polyfit(x, y, 1)
513            return abs(slope)
514        except Exception:
515            return 0.0
516
517    def _calculate_selection_pressure(self) -> float:
518        """Calculate selection pressure in population."""
519        fitnesses = [ind.fitness for ind in self.population if ind.fitness is not None]
520        if len(fitnesses) < 2:
521            return 0.0
522
523        best_fitness = min(fitnesses)
524        mean_fitness = np.mean(fitnesses)
525
526        if mean_fitness > 0:
527            return (mean_fitness - best_fitness) / mean_fitness
528        else:
529            return 0.0
